teaser: A researcher used an smart phone app to hack the cockpit of a virtual airplane. The setting was a computer security conference in Amsterdam. The FAA and several makers of cockpit equipment say that feat would be much harder, if not impossible, in a real aircraft. We asked regular contributer Chester Wisnewski at computer security firm Sophos if he gives this much credence. He doesn't -- but he does think the story could make flying safer.
byline: Sabri Ben-Achour, Katie Long, Chester Wisniewski, David Brancaccio, Jeremy Hobson and Mark Garrison
